dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: People think corruption is just about big money, but actually it often starts with small favors, like land plots for relatives.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: People think corruption is just about big money, but actually it often starts with small favors, like land plots for relatives.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly. Like in Zhambyl region, these two akims were fined for exactly that. One gave a plot to his mother-in-law.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly. Like in Zhambyl region, these two akims were fined for exactly that. One gave a plot to his mother-in-law.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Two rural akims (governors) in the Zhambyl region have been fined for violating anti-corruption laws by allocating land plots to their relatives, according to the press service of the regional court.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, a 0.0692-hectare plot, supposedly for gardening, but then it was converted to commercial use just two months later. That's uh, pretty blatant.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, a zero point zero six nine two-hectare plot, supposedly for gardening, but then it was converted to commercial use just two months later. That's uh, pretty blatant.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In December 2024, the mother-in-law of the akim of the Polatkosshi rural district was granted a 0.0692-hectare plot for gardening, which was converted to commercial use just two months later.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And the other akim's sister got a 0.1-hectare plot, plus ownership of another one she'd been renting. It's like they weren't even trying to hide it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the other akim's sister got a zero point one-hectare plot, plus ownership of another one she'd been renting. It's like they weren't even trying to hide it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The sister of the akim of the Karatobe district received rights to a 0.1-hectare plot and was also granted ownership of another plot she had previously rented.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: They didn't notify their superiors either, which is a clear conflict of interest. Article 680 of the Code of Administrative Offenses covers that, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They didn't notify their superiors either, which is a clear conflict of interest. Article six hundred eighty of the Code of Administrative Offenses covers that, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to case materials, both officials transferred land without notifying their superiors, creating a conflict of interest. The court ruled that the officials failed to prevent a conflict of interest, thereby violating Article 680 of the Code of Administrative Offenses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and both admitted guilt. They got fined 275,000 tenge each. Not exactly pocket change, but still…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and both admitted guilt. They got fined two hundred seventy five thousand tenge each. Not exactly pocket change, but still...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Both admitted guilt and were fined 275,000 tenge each.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, compared to that other case they mentioned—the credit partnership head embezzling over 150 million tenge—it seems almost small-scale.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, compared to that other case they mentioned-the credit partnership head embezzling over one hundred fifty million tenge-it seems almost small-scale.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Previously, authorities completed an investigation into the head of a credit partnership in the West Kazakhstan region, who was suspected of embezzling over 150 million tenge in state subsidies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But that's the thing, isn't it? These smaller abuses add up and erode public trust. It's not just about the amount.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But that's the thing, isn't it? These smaller abuses add up and erode public trust. It's not just about the amount.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And the fact that the rulings are already in force suggests there was pretty solid evidence.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And the fact that the rulings are already in force suggests there was pretty solid evidence.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The rulings have come into legal force.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Do you think fines are enough though? I mean, 275,000 tenge… is that really a deterrent?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Do you think fines are enough though? I mean, two hundred seventy five thousand tenge... is that really a deterrent?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Probably not for some officials, but at least it's on record now. Public exposure might hurt them more than the fine.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Probably not for some officials, but at least it's on record now. Public exposure might hurt them more than the fine.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: True. And it sets a precedent. Maybe others will think twice before handing out land to family.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True. And it sets a precedent. Maybe others will think twice before handing out land to family.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Hopefully. Corruption's a tough cycle to break, especially in local governance.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hopefully. Corruption's a tough cycle to break, especially in local governance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's a start, but there's a long way to go.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's a start, but there's a long way to go.
